intro: Euphrasia flabellata, commonly known as the fan-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and lanceolate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Euphrasia flabellata is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
